p: SARS-CoV emerged in 2002 in southern China (Guangdong Province), as a novel clinical severe disease and rapidly spread to other 28 countries ( 31, 33). All early cases had a history of contact with living animals (in wet markets or restaurants). Molecular and serological data, and isolation, demonstrated that SARS-CoV originated from civet cats ( Figure 1A), family Viverridae, in Guangdong market, and also that farmed civets did not play a role as reservoirs ( 31, 34, 35).
